On november 14, 2010
Nuke
Satellite, your Softpig is lacking the Wrath- and Strength paths entirely, but since it's a softpig, you should be ok if you take them this late. And usually you wouldn't want Perception, in case that's the water level-up that means you can't get Sumo.
Endurance is definitely a way to go in Wood.

TigerroxCP, you should take the time to unlock some of the other paths as well. Moueffes are usually only at their best when they have all the counter attack skills (so you want to work with the Wrath- and Strength paths too). In wood it might have been smarter to get Endurance in stead of Savagery. I'm fond of going for Basalt Armor, Faroe Heritage and Vines. Celerity is never a bad choice. But it would have been better with Air if you hadn't unlocked so fast, but gotten Strategy too.

IMHO, initiative is pretty important.

On november 23, 2010
[765481]
flight : good for pve in the beginning , because you will save some hp , but please DONT take it .
Eventuelly you´ll end up grouping your dinoz , so you only make the enemy hit someone else from your team . Next thing is : you can take it WHENEVER you want , but it WONT lead to another skill , so it will take you an additional air level until you reach tier 2 skills .

the rest is up 2 you : take a look @ some skill guides and find out what you want your glid to be . Shall it be a fighter ? merchant u skill? priest u skill ?

if he´s supposed to become a fighter , you should take strategy and agility , to get specialist and ( more important ) elasticity ( to get the overload double skill ) . After that , you´re still able to choose mistral->unlock->tornado to do some extra damage ( mistral is too weak , early in the life of your glidwing , because the chances of getting air is just too small for making serious damage early on )

On november 25, 2010
Loppermann
well firstly, the best form of defence is attack... the quicker you can kill an opponent, the less damage it's going to do, so just sitting there absorbing hits with lots of isn't going to be very useful
secondly, if you must make a build that is designed to just sit there and be attacked, lightning dance isn't a good skill to get as if it uses it on something that has torch or acid blood you will lose a lot of health
also, if your winks isn't designed to attack, then it has to make the most of the support skills it can learn... to leave out electrolysis is almost criminal, and leafy dawn isn't going to do as much as it would coming from a Rocky, Wanwan or Glidwings
Hospital Porter is a pretty useless skill in PvP as if you won the fight (the only time a skill like this would work, unless hypnosis is involved) then you will most likely have time to recover and 5 is negligible anyway
you are also extremely unlikely to get to Colossus on a winks, and Vines is a more accessible and more useful alternative

I tried to create a defensive winks on the French server... it failed miserably
just don't do it, Winks are far better at other things to simply be heavy punching bags

Wobby
Here's what I suggest:

Just get Vines and then either Korgon Reinforcemetns or Growth, or just Vines if you can avoid it after CP.

Get Life Guard too. You also will want Acid Blood. Yes, Acid Blood is a really good skill. Remember to get Marsh for Electrolysis. Absolute Zero might be a good choice too.

I'd say you have a realy small chance of Burning Heart. Just get Warm Blood, and maybe you'll pull off a few Floods with the extra Initiative. A good offence is a good defence.

Just take Celerity Path. As long as you stick it on a team with something that has Leafy Dawn, you should be covered for healing. Don't get Lightning Dance.

Just get Vaporous Form and Vivacious Wind.

On november 26, 2010
Wobby
Here's my plan for an offensive Moueffe... Not a Softpig because the only way they can get good Counterattack is if they get Wakikido and that lowers initiative by a huge chunk... Although a D Softpig would be better than an offensive Moueffe. So here we go:

(23+)
Just take Burning Claws and Wrath. Then take all the level 2 paths, unlock, and then Vengeance, Lava Flow, Incandescent Aura, Burning Heart, Nap, Combustion, and Fireball. That’s all level 3 paths that you have minus Giant Hunter. Unlock, and then get Torch, Meteors, and Self Control. Unlock again and get Brave. You’ll probably unlock Vendetta with your third or fourth unlock, so get that once you unlock it. If you feel like you’re going to get a lot of , then you can get the path to Vigilance after your first unlock, and you won’t waste any levels. Or you can take it from the beginning, but there’s the possibility that you won’t get the levels that you need for everything. If you have any more level
(7+)
Take all three paths, unlock, and then get Vines, Growth, and Korgons plus another unlock to Acrobat. With the extras that you’ll probably have, get Wild Instinct, Wide Jaw, and Cocoon if you don’t like spending 3 days resting even with Priest. If you still have any extras, get Primal State for some support.

(6+)
Take the paths to Specialist and Achilles’ Heel for Vendetta. There’s not much to go for with extra levels, so just try to get Dodge or something. Another option is to unlock or pick Vendetta if you’re not getting enough .

(5)
Rush the obvious Sumo. Go for Aqueous Clone with any extras.

(1-5)
Take Celerity path and hope you get Career Plan early. If not, at least you have Celerity and maybe Double Hit.

Spheres
2 , 3 , 1
Hypnosis and Good Whack are always good skills to have if you want them.

So that’d be:
+45% Speed
+6 Initiative
20% Multi if you get Double Hit
25% Counter-attack

What do you guys think?

what skills should a speed/ initiative dino have
On november 27, 2010
Wobby
Warm Blood, Hazard, Reflex, and Kaos Path+Kamikaze=Sprint all raise initiative

Acrobat, Celerity, Adrenaline, and Lightning Attack all raise speed. Oh, and Brave raises speed, but it's on the path of skill that lowers Initiative.

Wanwans and Rockys are pretty much the only dinoz that can get +22 Initiative along with good speed. Hippos can, but Wanwans and Rockys outclass them at that...

On december 6, 2010
AndySQdancer
Markisa, it depends on how much Wood you think your Dinoz is going to get and your Plans for him in the Future. Determine how many Level Ups in Wood your Dinoz is going to get by the Time he will be finished Leveling Up. Then make your Plan for the Dinoz by Charting those Level Ups on a Wood Skills Tree, using each Level Up in Wood for either a Wood Skill or an Unlocking of Wood Skills. Remember, you want to use the Minimun # of Unlocks. (I would even put a pencil number on the Skills Tree on each of the Skills and Unlocks you plan to take in the order you plan to acquire them.) Then, periodically update this Chart as your Dinoz Levels Up making corrections for the Dinoz actually getting more or less Wood Level Ups as you had previously Planned. Simple process, the only Real Hard part is coming up with the Correct Answers for the First Two Questions.

=== : * * : ===

Assuming you get CP at level 15, you have a ~15% chance of getting at least 20.
Assuming you get CP at level 20 you have a ~5% chance of getting at least 20.

Just something you might want to consider.

To be honest, I think the most you need or want is 13, because that's when you start wasting levels on unessecary skills.

And Torch on a Rocky... Waste of level ups. IMO, the only thing that's worth getting on a Rocky is Combustion, and it's not worth 3 levels. I don't plan on going for Meteors or and other A skills, because "slow down" my Rocky because A skills will trigger and not receive the 90% speed increase that ones do. And you can always use Lighters. Sure it might take up an inventory slot, but at least it doesn't take 4 level ups to get. Also, chances are you won't have enough when you're at level 40-50 to get Sprint and all the other good skills because you went for Torch, and your Rocky will end up being Reincarnated or becoming Demon Fodder.

On december 11, 2010
Wobby
Hmm... What would a Hippoclamp with Earth Tremor be like?
(7)
Wrath path only. Unlock, and then get Fury and Warm Blood and then unlock again. Incandescent Aura and Burning Heart last. Self Control and/or Meteors with extra levels. Another alternative to is to rush Brave and then get Burning Heart I guess…
(8)
Take Carapace and Savagery paths, unlock. Get Vines, and Korgon Reinforcements, and unlock again. Then go get Wild Instinct and Acrobat. Primal State and Earth Tremor with extras, and if you get any more,
(7)
Mutation, unlock, Underwater Karate and Ventral Pouch. Unlock again, and Sumo and Aqueous Clone. Unavoidable levels after Career Plan should go into Perception/Acupuncture/Acid Blood.
(10)
Get Celerity and Intelligence and unlock. Double Hit, Lightning Attack, First Aid and unlock again. Then Career Plan, Adrenaline, and Hazard. Overload and Lightning with any extras that you get.
(9)
Take Agility and Mistral first, and unlock. Dodge and Tai Chi next. Unlock and get Elasticity and Ejector Palms. Unlock again for the two Double Skills. If you want to you can get Vacuum Disk before the unlock and get Black Hole too. Extra levels should go into Vivacious Wind after that.
Double Skills (2)
Assuming you unlock Overload and Earth Tremor at the same time, then it will only take you that one unlock to get both of the double skills. I don’t think it matters too much what elements you use to get the double skills, but Overload is probably preferably gotten with an level up, but if you get an extra it won’t make much of a difference.

Pretty much focuses on assaults, speed, and some nice Earth Tremors, all for those annoying Bubble guys. I think if your Hippo had Lightning and Sinuous too, it could be pretty fast also.

On january 19, 2011
Piemaster
You seem to have fallen for the old 'take every skill' syndrome.

Have you checked out the full skill trees? They are available on most of the larger clan sites (ours for example, and Death's Children's are popular). You will notice that a lot of the higher level skills are much more powerful than the lower level ones. Therefore on elements you don't expect to roll a lot of (everything except on a Glidwings for example) you shouldn't take every skill, but should instead follow a path to a higher level skill you really want. For example, in you might shoot for Sumo, or in for Life Breath, Black Hole or Specialist.

Hope this is at least somewhat helpful.

On january 19, 2011
Piemaster
I assume you're talking about the skill Black Hole? It basically removes an enemy from the combat without actually killing them. This is pretty useless in PvE (because you want to kill all the monsters to get the XP), but very useful in PvP, where a numerical advantage is often decisive.

In terms of your Glidwing, the traditional advice at this point would be to turn him into a collector because he'll never be a great fighter. Personally I'm not a huge fan of this advice, I think you would be a lot better off keeping him going as a fighter and using him to try out skills so you know how they work for your future dinos. And if you grab all the speed and initiative boosts in lightning and maybe head for Leafy Dawn and Blazing Twilight, he won't be half bad. Once you have a full compliment of dinos and have tried out a lot of skills you can start to make decisions about which ones you want to keep and which you want to freeze/sacrifice to make space.

One piece of advice I would give you ath this point is buy as many dinos as possible. Although you've got two others, which is good, you could get even more and it would really help you make money faster. And now you know how the skill trees work they would be better than your current ones too

Piemaster
TO be honest, it doesn't matter too much which order you get skills, if you plan on getting them all eventually. If you want to be the most powerful as quickly as possible, I would say Lightning Dance and Lightning will give you more bang for your buck than Adrenaline or the Paths at this stage (or Career Plan if you're a control freak).

You have a real lack of so far, which means you might want to focus purely on the Dodge path. Maybe just go (Unlock) - Dodge - (Unlock) - Vacuum Disk - Elasticity - (Unlock) - Black Hole - Overload then use Career Plan to avoid any more .

For , just head to Sumo

For heading for Pirmal State/Shock is probably your best bet

since you´re not in a clan , you dont need gather skills or brave .

but if you ever intend on joining a clan , all three gather skills should be taken on a new dino ( it will take too long for you )

smashroom hunter also leads to lava flow , wich is good , but no must have due to ridiculously low trigger rate .

I would go for skills , that let´s you unlock new important skills , and choose "dead-end"skills later .

Dead-end skills for example : waikikido ( if you dont go for the basalt armor double skill ) , burning heart , and so on .
So i would choose inadecent aura right now , afterwards combustion ( turn it off in pve ) and nap ( turn it off until you get self controll ) .

Take a look if there are other skills you want to unlock , but if you choose those 3 skills , you will have meteors , selfcontrol ( avoid poison as soon as you enter the steppes ) and torch very soon , wich makes him a formidable pve fighter , and because of torch , even a decent defender in certain circumstances .

Piemaster
Just to play devil's advocate I would take Burning Heart, purely and simply because it is the available skill that will make your dino better fastest and definitely won't be a wasted pick. In reality though it doesn't matter too much. If you stick at it, you will be taking most of those skills in the end, so the precise order you get them in doesn't matter too much. For now just steer clear of the ones you may not want to take at all. For example you wont want Charge unless you plan on getting the 'Sprint' double skill, and you only need to take Smashroom Hunter if you badly want Lava Flow.

[None]
what are the best pvp skills? i see vines a lot but what are other powerful skills?
On february 23, 2011
Piemaster
Like most things in the game, it depends on a lot of things. The format, how many dinos per side, whether you are attacking or defending, the other dinos in the group etc can cause the value of skills to vary wildly. For example Black Hole is excellent in clan wars, especially when defending, but is useless in the dojo. Flight is excellent in 1v1 combat but practically useless in 5v5. Poison rules the dojo but is easily countered in clan wars. Having said that, the following skills are pretty much universally good in PvP:

Life Breath
Specialist
Vacuum Disk
Fireball
Meteors
Self Control
Leafy Dawn
Blazing Twilight
Adrenaline (and other speed/initiative skills)
Lightning
Lightning Dance
Kaar-Sher Beam
Accupuncture
Life Guard
Aquaeous Clone
Sumo
Gorriloz Spirit
Vines

There are other good ones too, but those are probably the best in terms of power and casting frequency (where applicable). I have left off the poison skills because they are hit and miss depending on whether your opponent has poisonite/antidote. I have also missed out sphere and double skills (these are mostly good with a couple of exceptions).

[765481]
well to be honest ... he isnt that messed up .

He can still be of some use in battles / defense , AND can get your clan some very needed hunting ingredients .

for fire : start grabbing the counter skills and move towards brave
for wood : get vines and hope to avoid everything else . If not , unlock and get primal state and acrobat ( i would prefer acrobat first ) .
lightning : thats where you messed up totaly , but ok , get celerity , unlock , get adrenaline and lightning attack , you will get a decent speed boost out of it .
water : obvious : rush sumo . Since you´re well advanced level-wise , you shouldnt try to get aquaoeus clones and sumo , so avoid underwater karate , just rush pouch and sumo .
air : obvious again : you´ve choosen the right path to get vendetta ( accidently ? ) , so get it .

you might end up with a torch defender with nearly 40 % counterchance ,enough hp due to burning heart , brave , waikikido and hopefully sumo , that is more than average fast .

Problem with this build is , its half fish , half meat .
The normal case of an defender moueffe is : slow as hell , to give as much counters with his main element as possible . ( therefore : colossus )
You will only have an ini boost from plus 1 ( 4 minus 3 ) , so you still have a chance of countering nicely .

Dont get me wrong , he wont ever be an outstanding defense dino , but probably more than average ( in comparisson to non bubble dinoz ) . The big plus here is your ability to gather in non-war-times .

On march 3, 2011
mtp85
Anything's possible, it's just not likely. The heavy Dinoz (Moueffe, Pteroz, Softpig) don't really get enough to go after both Sumo and Bubble. Sirain could get Torch (no Brave), Sumo, and Bubble, but then you don't get as much damage from Torch.

The easiest way is probably to use a Hippoclamp.

Fire: Rush Torch and Brave (no Fury, no Burning Heart, no Fireball)
13 level ups

Water: Rush Sumo and Sapper
8 level ups

Lightning: Rush Career Plan
5 level ups

Air: Rush Vaporous Form
5 level ups

Plus 2 more Air/Water level ups to get Bubble, since you have to get the 2 prerequisite skills, then unlock Bubble, then select Bubble. (So you'd be at least level 48 in your scenario, since you start at level 1 and need 2 level ups to get Bubble.) There will probably be some level ups in there, so you'll still probably be in the 40s before you get all of that.

the difference with bubble skills is , that you can choose it with an air level up , even if you´ve unlocked it with water .

On march 29, 2011
[945719]
I don't think that the speed boost on A skills is true. I everyone thinks that it works this way but it isn't what I have observed.

The way it seems to me is that you get a speed boost on what would be a lightning assault whether your dinoz does an assault or an A skill. It even seems to be a boost on non lightning A skills (like meteors) if the dinoz would have done a lightning assault that turn. If the dinoz is on another element for assaults and does a lightning A skill, there is no speed boost.

That's just the way it looks to me, but most people don't agree.

On march 30, 2011
[765481]
you seem to forget about initiative ... there are lots of threads here about that topic, but to sum up :

every dino starts with a certain random amount of initiative. It wont have a range from zero to infite , but its at least a bit random, maybe +3 or -2 , something like that, is possible.

every attack costs initiative. The dino with the highest initiative starts. Thats how the order of attacks is calculated. Speed determines how fast you regenerate initiative/ or lets say, how much initiative is lost per attack.

theres no speed bonus from the sheer amount of elements in lightning, nor is there any ( confirmed ) racial difference in speed .

So what you observe is the combination of celerity and warmblood.

higher initiative lets you attack first. Celerity gives you an additional attack right away, compared to lower ini monsters ( low level dinoz who pick celerity first will attack some mushrooms 2 times right away, even without an initiative boost, depending on their random starting ini, but its quite often )
Since you´ve also skilled lightning attack, and lightning is your second strongest element, your second strike is even faster than your first ( even with that +4 ini ) , so you´re probably attacking a third time .

this has nothing to do with "softpigs are faster" or "having much lightning makes you faster" , so dont get confused ^^

If you keep on levelling your rocky, get warmblood, hazard, lightning attack, and adrenaline ( maybe acrobat ) and eventuelly the first lightningsphere skill reflex , you will see that your rocky will be FAR superior in speed, even if you are going to choose acrobat and brave on your softpig ( selfcontrol and waikikido make up for that boost, with lowering your initiative ).

Btw : percentages arent added in this game, they are multiplied, so those 50% and 40% from lightningskills are even better than you might think from the start.

[765481]
to be honest : u already screwed up with taking all three tier 1 fire skills. There is absolutly NO use in trying to make something freeky out of it , and hoping on a certain amount of fire to come . Just stick to what you have, and choose the best skills you can have right now... there are lots of tier 3 skills, so dont wait anymore. Get waikikido, get burning heart, and then start to think about what you should do next. 2 fire might occur in the next 2 levels, but the other case could be taking nap and never roll fire again. Waikikido would lead to basalt armor anyways, wich is quite decent. Next thing is : self control, what you want to aim for, would lead to the following situations :

avoid poison : poisonites can do that aswell if hes your leader ... and you dont want to let him fight in dojo anyways, do you ?
avoid slowing : its a gorilloz after all...prolly faster then some other dinoz, but lightning dinoz still outrun you in every possible way so ... kinda pointless .
avoid petryfiing : same ... you wont care if your gorilloz leader got turned to stone, as long as your faster/stronger team dinoz arent.

It has its good sides, i admit, and i would want self control on my gorilloz, but since you already have the choice on choosing tier 3 skills, you better do so as long as you have the chance .
Self control also means that you lose speed ( in that case : ini ) so in the end, you dont gain as much use in terms of avoid getting slowed/petryfied, than you might think in the beginning. So choosing waikikido, becoming slower, but having more chances to deal a devastating woodcounter is the better choice imho . And in combination to burning heart, those extra hp are quite more usefull than everything selfcontrol could offer to you.
You might even consider burning breath afterwards ( 1 waiki , 1 burning heart , 1 basalt armor after an eventually wood unlock , 1 burning breath, means 12 fire ... decent enough for an aoe attack )


long text and pretty biased, but i hope i could give you some ideas.

What is double skill and how can i get it? I have few dinoz having level 3 skills like Wakikido, Kamikaze, primal state and combustion, what should i do to get double skill?
On april 20, 2011
Loppermann
for a double skill, you need a certain two skills (for example, for the Bubble double skill, your dinoz needs to know the skill Sapper and the skill Vaporous Form), then you have to talk to Madam X at Brutforce (to see her you need to have done Grandpa Joe's mission The Lost Dog) and she will allow you to learn a double skill
then next time you level up, if you roll either element that the double skill is comprised of, you can unlock that skill and learn it whenever you level up after that and you roll either element that skill is comprised of

each double skill is comprised of specific skills, and there are guides to these in many clan pages

Loppermann
so far for a noob your softpig is actually quite good at this stage... you have pretty much chosen the right secondary element skills
however, it looks like you spend all the money you started the game with on irma potions... for now, don't spend the gold you earn in the game on anything other than new dinoz (get the 16,000 ones from now on... softpigs are good, but they are expensive when you start off in the game), as the more dinoz you get, the more gold you earn per day, the more progress you make each day etc...
also, with multiple dinoz you can group them so they lose less , gain more (generally) and earn more gold
On may 11, 2011
Loppermann
one thing I forgot to add, for a dinoz's main element (the one it is most likely to roll when it levels up) it is best to learn all tier 1 skills then unlock, not learn one and then unlock and then learn another and unlock etc
you save lots of level ups if you have a plan of what skills you want with consideration to how likely you are to roll them
many clans have complete skill trees on their help pages (I know the English Connection have public ones... see Loamoats' profile and click on his clan)

On may 12, 2011
Loppermann
Mutoh, want my advice? Don't get a Moueffe, get a Glidwings

DarkTolrance, you can't choose what element you roll when you level up, they are predetermined as soon as you get the dinoz (unless you learn the skill "Career Plan"... but we won't complicate things with that for now)

if you get , learn Strength, as this will lead you eventually to the skill Waikikido, which is useful for softpigs
if you roll , I would suggest going for Carapace, but I'm sure others would disagree and say Endurance, so either option can work really... because is not a softpig's main element you want to try and select the best skills instead of all of them, so generally you only follow one (maybe two) skill paths... Carapace eventually leads to vines (this skill effects the enemy's initiative, which is vital... if it doesn't have enough initiative it won't attack), Endurance leads to the double skill basalt armour, which gives your dinoz a strengthened shield
if you roll , choose unlock, as this will eventually lead to the skill sumo (this skill increases your dinoz total by 100... VERY important skill)... with any dinoz that has 1-3 chances to roll you want to be rushing to sumo as fast as you can
if you roll , you want to unlock so you can eventually learn career plan and double hit, both useful skills
finally, if you roll , you should learn either agility (which leads to black hole) or strategy (which leads to the double skill vendetta), but you only want to choose one of these paths, as softpigs have only a small chance of rolling
On may 12, 2011
Piemaster
No, it's not correct. The only thing you can do to influence the choice is to get the skill 'Career Plan' (level 3 ), which allows you to roll twice and pick the best roll out of the two.

On may 13, 2011
Piemaster
I think it's usually a bad idea to start buying dinos that will both make money and be good fighters. Pick one or the other. A dino with collecting skills (except those that lead places) will never be great fighters because they have wasted skills. Oh sure, they'll be fine to do missions in dinotown or whatever, but any dino is fine for that really.

Buy some dinos that will be fighters and other dinos that wil be collectors and/or u-skillers. For the fighters, given them skills that will make them the best on the battlefield (in whatever time frame you deem to be relevant). For the collectors and U-skillers, give them the money making and utility skills that will benefit your *account* rather than that dino specifically.

On may 21, 2011
Loppermann
go to the University (just north of Dinotown) with your softpig and speak to the professor -> click learn -> select climbing gear and defeat the fire elemental (you will need a decent amount of for this... 50% should do it, but you might want to buy a battle ration and equip it to your softpig) -> you can then access the basalt slopes (north of precipitous hills) -> here there will be a "strange dinoz" -> fight this dinoz (once again you will need a decent amount of ) -> if you beat it, you will be able to buy Pteroz in your daily shop
one might not show up every day, but there will be one eventually

but, to be honest, Pteroz aren't really the best dinoz, especially early in the game as they are more expensive
really, the best option for you now is anything that costs 16,000

On may 23, 2011
HugoMVP
Rob:

About the Sprint/Brave Rocky, I used to think like you, and I have a Rocky at level 27 with 8 ups in fire on his way for both those skills. But... a clan mate of mine made me see the power of a Meteors/Brave Rocky With Brave, Incadescent Aura, Corrosive Archangel, and your 13 ups, that's 23 elements right there. Can you see the meteors damage? Besides, I don't value Sprint as much as I used too. It's only your starting initiative, which means if you get a simple Vines it's all gone. Sure, it can help getting the first hit, but luck also plays a role, and I would say warm blood, hazard, and the first sphere will have to do. At this point, I value more speed over initiative, because when we talk about the initiative of a dino, it's only the extra starting initiative, so I would rather have a faster dino spamming Vines or Flood, than a dino with more initative. All it can help, is to have a better chance at the first Vines/Flood.

About the Brave Wanwan, I think it depends on the kind of wanwan you want. Wanwans are the best team leaders, imo, and so brave makes no sense in them. But if you already have a wanwan for team leader, why not? It might be just a little hard to get, Rockys have a better chance and even then they can be stubborn and not get the 9 ups (10 with BH). But even if you don't get to brave, burning heart and self-control are great. Ever since I decreased my expectations about initiative, I think Self-control is a great skill to have.

Although I don't have a mahamuti, what's a good mahamuti build? This is what I suggest:

On june 4, 2011
Wobby
Just thought I'd share:

Acrobat/Celerity = +15%

Acrobat + Celerity = +32%

Acrobat + Celerity + Brave = +52%

Acrobat + Celerity + Lightning Attack =
• +85% for Lightning Assaults
• +32% for other Assaults
• Average +42% (without Specialist)

Celerity + Lightning Attack + Adrenaline =
• 141% for Lightning Assaults
• 15% for other Assaults
• Average 40% (without Specialist)

Acrobat + Celerity + Lightning Attack + Adrenaline =
• +177% for Lightning Assaults
• +32% for other Assaults
• Average +61% (without Specialist)

Acrobat + Celerity + Lightning Attack + Adrenaline + Brave =
• +219% for Lightning Assaults
• +52% for other Assaults
• Average +85% (without Specialist)

That means a Moueffe with Brave and Acrobat and Celerity can outrank a non-mono'd Rocky in terms of speed by about 12%. The Rocky obviously still would win in terms of initiative.

On june 6, 2011
HugoMVP
Mutoh, I don't know which dino race you are talking about, but I can answer the brave matter.

15% speed and 50hp can make a world of a difference in a dino, so it is worth it. But let's analyze the PVP situation of a dino with brave:

-Can participate in dojos (so having brave is a big advantage)
-Can participate in cotcs (same)
-Can participate in castle defenses during wars (same)
-With the new rules, a dino attacking solo will only find one dino in defense, or more if they are really low level. Before it would find 5, but with this war rules, the biggest brave handicap was corrected.
-You can't use it for teams in the dome or to attack devourers. That's the only handicap remaining for PVP.

So, in conclusion, Brave is definitely worth it. You should still have a team of 5. Even fire heavy dinoz will only have brave at a high level (meaning non-fire dinoz will only have brave at a very high level), meaning you can train a substitute in time for when the dino gets brave.

The max level is 50.

On june 9, 2011
Aleblacksito
Well Mutoh that's quite an ambitious plan you have there but you might run into a couple of problems once you start leveling.

paths: It seems to me that you are getting far too many skills for a winks. In my opinion, taking the perception path in a winks should only be oriented towards getting Marsh and thus unlocking the Electrolysis double skill with Adrenaline. Also for a winks to get life guard you would have to compromise several skills in other elements, which, according to your tight plan, you can't afford.

paths: I've heard about taking the focus path on a winks before but I'm not sure if it's the best thing to do, especially if your goal is to get corrosive and genesive archangels (skills elusive even to dinoz like wanwans and rockies). I would advise you to stay on the celerity and intelligence paths and head for adrenaline, hazard, lightning and CP (maybe even reincarnation if you decide to resurrect Riley further on).

paths: This is a tricky one in your case since you have wasted a level-up on strategy. Go for either bubble or overload, not for both, unless you plan to level Riley to 40+. Bubble is, imo, the best choice here since Riley will last a lot more than most other non-bubble dinoz in pvp batttles. Also by not taking the agility path you have more space to get both vivacious wind and life breath, both great pvp skills.

paths: With only 10% chance in the element, your best bet is to get vines and possibly get primal state. I would get growth only after you get to primal state and roll after using CP (no other choice).

paths: Getting warm bood is the main goal and after that I would just use CP to avoid further fire rolls.

Disclaimer: I'm by no means an "expert" in this game so don't just dogmatically follow my advice. One thing that I've discovered about this game is that you have to adapt your strategies as you level a dinoz. They may not turn out as you expected, so be ready for any changes to your ideal builds.

theres no difference compared to your elemental attack

if colossus adds 5 damage per element, its the same as if you would have an extra element in the element you are attacking right now, so just do some tests in the dojo.

1 element equals five damage. Since skills like martial arts, growth, strenght, diamant fangs (lol), giant and collossos add damage on every element, every 5 extra damage equal one element. So nothing changes regarding the damage formula and the element defense wich applies at the moment.

[765481]
hmm well no... not really ok ^^

take a look at this thread please, http://en.dinorpg.com/forum/thread/15662 1.

The problem is: whats the best use for a first dino. There are lot of possibilitys.
The "pro" opinion on your dino would be, that intelligence was the wrong choice in lightning, even though you could get the electrolysis double skill, you should have went "celerity->unlock->doublit(lightni ng attack)-> unlock->CarrerPlan(Hazard).

On water, dont unlock too early. You dont have to unlock every skill on each own, wich means you could skill all 3 tier 1 skills ( mutation, water canon, perception), then unlock once to have all 6 tier 2 skills avaiable. This is the overall best way on dinoz wich are very heavy on one element.

BUT he can still fulfill his role as a first dino. Go on and get watercanon and perception, then ventral pouch, then unlock (in that order). You only "wasted" 1 unlock, then you can get decent fighting skills (aim for sumo, aquaous clones, poisoned claws and acid blood, and he will be more than good to survive in pve). Other options, as seen in the linked thread, are making him a U-skiller and Gatherer. You wont ever see all of us agreeing on wich is supposed to be the best way, so its up to you.

Check some other threads (search function) and the sticky guide, to get a glimps of what you should do in the beginning

On july 21, 2011
Wobby
Tireless is +2 in all defenses, but works like Absolute Zero rather than Endurance.

Defense
4+3+10.5+6+3=26.5 (27, rounded up)
27+25+2=54 (25 is from absolute zero)

Defense
6+6+10.5+2+3=28
28+2=30

Defense
6+9+21+2+1=39
39+2=41

Defense
2+9+31.5+4+1=48
48+2=50

I'd do , but I'm lazy.

But in short, I'm pretty sure Tireless is 5 Endurances in each element, so Basalt Armour is probably the better choice, especially if it's bubble dinoz.

Correct me if I'm wrong anywhere in my post

On august 12, 2011
ZenNukshuk
i thought you just pick all the skills they had then move to level 2 skill.NO

Each "type" of dinoz has a different % likelihood of the different elements, so for a dinoz that has only 5% chance of any element (for 49 level ups this is less than 3 times it will hit that element, on average)
So for those dinoz if you pick all three paths at level 1 you will get no further - better to pick one path at level 1 then level up then get a skill at 2nd level like vines or double hit or ventral pouch or warm blood or dodge.

For dinoz that are mosly one element, like moueffe then yes in that element typically take all 3 paths at level 1 then unlock

and for those that are two main elements, maybe 2 paths in their main elements

hope this helps

On august 12, 2011
Piemaster
Most of those skills you picked are 'good skills', but 'good skill' is often subjective.

Take Water Canon for example. The damage this does is dependant on your attack strength, so on some dinos is does massive damage. A level 30 Sirain could be doing over 150 damage to low-defence mobs with it. On the other hand, a Moueffe will not roll much so it will have a very low water attack strength and most of the time Water Canon will do 1 damage and often replace an attack that would have done a lot more.

A skill like Mutation on the othe rhand is always useful on any dino as the extra 30HP is fixed.

On august 12, 2011
Dch75
Well the Wanwan is level 7 and the Gorill is level 4. What skills should I be looking for them. Also in the next day or so I'll be getting a Cloudoz and tips on thoses?
On august 12, 2011
Piemaster
Well rather than giving you tips or builds for this or that dino, the best advice I can give is to think of every dino the same way. Look at their level-up table and see how much of each element they get. For example, your Wanwan is:

15%
30%
5%
40%
10%

Now halve each of these numbers (rounding down if close) and you will get approximte *average* number of that element they will get by level 50. In this case:

7
15
2
20
5

Now think about what you want to do with those level ups, write it down, and work your way towards that. Of course you may have to adapt your plan if you get a strange string of rolls, but that's okay. Where the numbers are low you will probably looking at aiming for one particular skill. So in the example above you only expect to get 5 , os maybe you should aim for Specialist or Elasticity. Where the numbers are big you can pick 2-3 entire trees you want to get all the skills for.
On august 12, 2011
Wobby
Although you should keep in mind it takes years to get to level 50 if you don't pay real money to buy Iramas. It's a better idea to make your builds planned for say, level 35 or 40 if you don't plan on spending real money.

On august 18, 2011
fangstriker
I have a question:

What does Focus actually do?
On august 18, 2011
Nuke
Focus gives your next assault (if you make a regular assault that turn) a bonus equal to the lightning element of your dinoz.

It's not particularly noticeable in PvP unless you have a pretty high lightning element.
